info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 9:44AM CDT until April 23 at 2:31PM CDT by NWS Lincoln IL
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...
Little Wabash River below Clay City affecting Clay and Richland Counties.
.The following forecasts are based on observed precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and forecast precipitation.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Little Wabash River below Clay City.
* WHEN...From this morning to early Wednesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 19.7 feet, Mayflower Road...just north of U.S. Route 50...begins to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 18.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 AM CDT Sunday was 18.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Persons with interests along this river need to remain aware of the latest forecasts and associated flood risk for their area. Stay tuned for further updates on this flooding situation.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON
